intro: Adenocalymma ciliolatum, commonly known as the silky bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive silvery foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are hairy and have a velvety texture, contributing to its common name. Adenocalymma ciliolatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
